settings.tab-text:
With an innovative approach to luxury, Eugenia Kim marries clean, classic shapes with fresh, feminine modernity and a playful sense of wit. Bold colors, unexpected trims and high-quality materials are the signature elements that define the collection every season.

After a cafeteria-tray ride down a snowy hill landed her a month-long stay in the hospital, Eugenia’s newfound dislike for these institutions did not agree with her pre-med track at Dartmouth University. Following graduation in 1996, Eugenia moved to New York to explore a different career path. She took a position at Allure magazine, while simultaneously taking a millinery class at Parsons School of Design.

In 1998, after a bad haircut, Eugenia created a feathered cloche to wear as a disguise. Boutiques in her downtown New York City neighborhood immediately took notice of the inventive design, and soon after, Barneys New York placed their first order. As a result, the Eugenia Kim brand was born.

The brand quickly grew in popularity, and Eugenia soon learned that she could not limit production to her small East Village three-roommate loft. She opened her first retail boutique, where she designed and sold hats in the storefront by day, and slept in a small room in the back at night.

settings.collection-description:
FW19 was inspired by the work of Gustav Klimt, especially his use of gold.  Klimt’s work is imbued with a certain warmth and sensuality,  and also a sense of mystery that we wanted to channel into the product.

We also loved his use of black and navy with silver accents.  For the tweeds, we started by looking at Jackson Pollack.  Color-wise, our palette calls on rich jewel tones accented with metallic…and lots of leopard, because the Eugenia Kim woman always loves leopard!

settings.tab-text: For a slimmer, more narrow-appearing forehead, try a brimmed style that’s medium in length as an ideal style for a heart shaped face.
Styles that feature a curved silhouette are ideal for softening more angular face shapes. Look to floppys, cloches and bowler styles to round out your features.

To create the desired length and height that will compliment a rounder face shape, look for styles with a tall crown. We also recommend medium to long brimmed fedoras, porkpies and trilby styles for this face shape.
Being one of the most versatile face shapes, an oval face works well with many styles. We recommend medium sized floppys, cloches, crushers or bucket hats for an oval face.

settings.title: APRIL 2, 1974
settings.description: Eugenia Kim is born in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.

settings.title: JUNE 1996
settings.description: Eugenia Kim breaks her back sledding, and after a month-long hospital stay decides not to pursue a career in medicine. Eugenia graduates from Dartmouth with a degree in Psychology.

settings.title: AUGUST 1997
settings.description: Eugenia enrolls in a millinery class at Parsons New School of Design.

settings.title: FEBRUARY 1998
settings.description: Eugenia shaves her head and creates a feathered hat as a disguise; that hat draws the attention of buyers in SOHO, leading to orders being placed and the birth of the brand.

settings.title: MAY 1998
settings.description: NY Times article announces the collection to be introduced at Barneys New York.

settings.title: MAY 1998
settings.description: W Magazine publishes first editorial styled with a Eugenia Kim hat.

settings.title: NOVEMBER 1998
settings.description: Eugenia Kim wins Gen Art Fresh Faces in Fashion Award.

settings.title: DECEMBER 1998
settings.description: Eugenia Kim opens her first store on East 4th street in New York City.

settings.title: SEPTEMBER 2001
settings.description: Eugenia Kim “haircut” hats and Nic headpiece appear in the Ben Stiller comedy Zoolander.

settings.title: SEPTEMBER 2001
settings.description: Jennifer Lopez and Janet Jackson wear Eugenia Kim hats at the MTV Video Music Awards.

settings.title: FEBRUARY 2002
settings.description: NY Times covers first Eugenia Kim runway collaboration with designer Alice Roi.

settings.title: OCTOBER 2002
settings.description: Beyoncé wears Eugenia Kim Honey hat on the cover of Vibe Magazine.

settings.title: FEBRUARY 2003
settings.description: Eugenia Kim collaborates with Michael Kors on hats for his Fall/Winter 2003 collection.

settings.title: NOVEMBER 2003
settings.description: Eugenia Kim launches first footwear collection.

settings.title: FEBRUARY 2004
settings.description: Eugenia Kim hat is worn by Carrie Bradshaw (Sarah Jessica Parker) in an episode of Sex and the City.

settings.title: JUNE 2004
settings.description: Eugenia Kim wins the Perry Ellis CFDA Award for Accessories Designer of the Year.

settings.title: JANUARY 2005
settings.description: Eugenia Kim is awarded by Fashion Group International as the Accessories Designer of the Year.

settings.title: FEBRUARY 2005
settings.description: Eugenia Kim collaborates with Donna Karan on Fall/Winter 2005 show.

settings.title: MAY 2005
settings.description: Genie by Eugenia Kim is launched for the Spring/Summer 2006 season.

settings.title: SEPTEMBER 2005
settings.description: Eugenia Kim launches Mr. Kim men’s line.

settings.title: FEBRUARY 2006
settings.description: Mr. Kim is featured in a GQ editorial.

settings.title: DECEMBER 2006
settings.description: Eugenia Kim’s first book Saturday Night Hat: Quick, Easy Hatmaking for the Downtown Girl, is published by Random House.

settings.title: FEBRUARY 2007
settings.description: Eugenia Kim collaborates on Side-Parted Hair Hats for the Catherine Malandrino FW07 runway show.

settings.title: MAY 2007
settings.description: Eugenia Kim collaborates with Warner Bros. on “Tweety Bird” hat.

settings.title: SEPTEMBER 2007
settings.description: Eugenia Kim collaborates with Michael Kors and DKNY for their SS08 collections at NYFW.

settings.title: OCTOBER 2007
settings.description: WWD announces Eugenia Kim x Coach collaboration.

settings.title: NOVEMBER 2007
settings.description: Eugenia Kim x Coach collaboration launches.

settings.title: JULY 2008
settings.description: WWD features Eugenia Kim x Michael Kors collaboration.

settings.title: SEPTEMBER 2008
settings.description: Eugenia Kim wins Cosmopolitan Fun Fearless Female Award.

settings.title: JULY 2009
settings.description: EEK! A capsule collection with Urban Outfitters launches.

settings.title: SEPTEMBER 2009
settings.description: Eugenia Kim collection is introduced at major retailers Neiman Marcus and Net-A-Porter.

settings.title: NOVEMBER 2009
settings.description: Eugenia Kim x Opening Ceremony collaboration of iconic “haircut” hats launches.

settings.title: APRIL 2010
settings.description: Eugenia Kim for Target launches.

settings.title: SEPTEMBER 2010
settings.description: Eugenia Kim launches first e-commerce website.

settings.title: SEPTEMBER 2013
settings.description: Kid Kim - a children’s line - launches.

settings.title: OCTOBER 2014
settings.description: Eugenia Kim is included in Saks With Avenue’s collaboration with Saturday Night Live for the TV show’s 40th Anniversary.

settings.title: FEBRUARY 2015
settings.description: The "Do Not Disturb" sunhat is born, and becomes the most successful Eugenia Kim hat to date; commercially, editorially as well as on social media.

settings.title: SEPTEMBER 2015
settings.description: Beyoncé wears "Do Not Disturb" sunhat in Instagram post.

settings.title: MARCH 2017
settings.description: Eugenia Kim further expands into accessories with the brand’s first handbag collection launch.

settings.title: MAY 2017
settings.description: Genie by Eugenia Kim launches a collaboration with celebrated designer Lilly Pulitzer.

settings.title: AUGUST 2017
settings.description: Eugenia Kim introduces a capsule collection of scarves.

settings.title: SEPTEMBER 2017
settings.description: Eugenia Kim makes NYFW debut for the brand’s SS18 collection.

settings.title: DECEMBER 2017
settings.description: Eugenia Kim re-launches e-commerce site, now a fully realized online shopping experience.

settings.title: FEBRUARY 2018
settings.description: Eugenia Kim celebrates its 20th Anniversary with a Retrospective of the brand’s most iconic styles alongside its FW18 NYFW Presentation. The retrospective collection is acquired exclusively by Barney’s.

settings.title: JUNE 2018
settings.description: EugeniaKim.com launches its first customization program, allowing shoppers to create their own unique word hats.

settings.custom-text: All customizable products are made-to-order, one-of-a-kind and are considered final sale. Please allow 48-72 business hours for production time. All trim add-ons are reflected in the price shown.
